name: chk files
func:
from os import listdir

basedir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/settings/'

msg['payload'] = ''

files = listdir(basedir)

for i in msg['settings']:
    if msg['overwrite'] != True:
        if i not in files:
            with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
                file.write(str(msg['settings'][i]))        
    else:
        with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
            file.write(str(msg['settings'][i])) 

msg['payload'] = True

return msg

name: create path
LED Status
func:
from OpenScan import fade_led, check_hotspot_mode, load_int

pin = load_int("pin_ringlight1")
pin2 = load_int("pin_ringlight2")

if check_hotspot_mode():
    msg['mode'] = True
    i=4
    j=30
else:
    msg['mode'] = False
    i=2
    j=30

for x in range (i):
    fade_led(pin,j, 50, True)
    #fade_led(pin2,j, 50, True)
    fade_led(pin,j, 50, False)
    #fade_led(pin2,j, 50, False)
    pass
return msg

from os import listdir

basedir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/settings/'

msg['payload'] = ''

files = listdir(basedir)

for i in msg['settings']:
    if msg['overwrite'] != True:
        if i not in files:
            with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
                file.write(str(msg['settings'][i]))        
    else:
        with open(basedir + i, 'w+') as file:
            file.write(str(msg['settings'][i])) 

msg['payload'] = True

return msg

name: infotext
format:
What's new?

  • speed improvement 2-3x
  • currently tested on OpenScan Mini + IMX519 with RPi 4
  • optimized toolpath
  • more responsive user interface
  • hotspot mode (when no wireless network available ssid: openscan pw: opensource
  • preview features and sharpness
  • partial background masking
  • no more autofocus --> instead you can set a min and max focus distance
note, that this is still an early beta and there might be some unintended bugs. please reach out to info@openscan.eu if you run into any issues.

name: Routine
func:
# The contents of this file are embedded in the OpenScan app (Node-RED)
from OpenScan import load_bool, load_str, load_int, load_float, motorrun, sort_spherical_coordinates_deg, create_coordinates, take_photo, save, \
    load_bool, camera
from OpenScanStatistics import ScanStatistics, ScanData
from time import sleep, strftime, time
from subprocess import getoutput, run
from datetime import datetime
from zipfile import ZipFile, ZIP_DEFLATED
from os import system, uname, remove
from os.path import isfile, getsize
import math
import threading
import numpy as np
import json

if load_str("status_internal_cam") == "no camera found" or load_str("status_internal_cam")[:5] == "Featu":
    return

stats = ScanStatistics()

save('status_internal_cam', 'Routine-preparing')
camera('/v1/camera/picam2_switch_mode?mode=1')
save('cam_sharparea', False)
save('cam_features', False)

architecture = load_str("architecture")
openscan_version = load_str("openscan_version")
openscan_branch = load_str("openscan_branch")
camera_model = load_str("camera")
shield = load_str("shield_type")
projectname = load_str("routine_projectname")
angle_max = load_int('rotor_anglemax')
angle_min = load_int('rotor_anglemin')
delete_aborted = load_bool('delete_aborted')
rotate_tt_first = load_bool('rotate_tt_first')
rotor_endstop_enable = load_bool('rotor_endstop_enable')
if rotor_endstop_enable:
    angle_start = load_int('rotor_endstop_angle')
    motorrun('rotor',angle_start/abs(angle_start) * 130, True)

else:
    angle_start = load_int('rotor_anglestart')


photocount = load_int('routine_photocount')

focus_min = load_float('cam_focus_min')
focus_max = load_float('cam_focus_max')
stacksize = load_int('cam_stacksize')
group_stack_photos = load_bool('group_stack_photos')

telegram_enable = load_bool('telegram_enable')
if telegram_enable:
    telegram_api_token = load_str('telegram_api_token')
    telegram_client_id = load_str('telegram_client_id')

if focus_min == focus_max:
    stacksize = 1

focuslist = []
if stacksize == 1:
    steps = 3 + int(abs(focus_max-focus_min)*0.8)
else:
    steps = stacksize

for i in range (steps):
    focuslist.append(min(focus_min,focus_max) + i * abs(focus_max-focus_min)/(steps-1))

msg['focuslist'] = focuslist
msg['payload2'] = []
counter = 0

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'
temppath = basepath + 'tmp2/preview.jpg'
zippath = basepath + 'tmp.zip'

projectcode = strftime('20%y-%m-%d_%H.%M.%S-') + projectname

if isfile(zippath):
    system('rm ' + zippath)
sleep(1)

coordinates = create_coordinates(angle_min, angle_max, photocount)
coordinates = sort_spherical_coordinates_deg(coordinates)

msg['payload'] = coordinates

position_last = (angle_start, 0)

zip = ZipFile(zippath, "a", ZIP_DEFLATED, allowZip64=True)

hostname = str(uname()[1])

starttime = time()

def get_current_timestamp():
    return datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M")

def get_eta(starttime, photocounter, count):
    return str(int((photocount / counter - 1) * (time() - starttime))) + '/' + str(
        int(photocount / counter * (time() - starttime))) + 's'

def photo(counter2):
    camera('/v1/camera/picam2_take_photo')
    returning[0] = focus(returning[0])
    zip.write(temppath, projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg")

def stack_photo(i):
    
    camera('/v1/camera/picam2_take_photo')
    if group_stack_photos:
        name = projectname + '_' + str(counter) + "/" + projectname + '_' + str(counter) + '-' + str(i) + '.jpg'
    else:
        name = projectname + '_' + str(counter) + '-' + str(i) + '.jpg'
    zip.write(temppath, name)
    
def stack_focus(i):
    sleep(load_float('cam_shutter')/1000000*2)
    if i < len(focuslist)-1:
        camera('/v1/camera/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focuslist[i+1]))
    else:
        camera('/v1/camera/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focuslist[0]))
    sleep(1.7)

def photo_stack():
    camera('/v1/camera/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(focuslist[0]))
    for i in range(len(focuslist)):
        if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
            break
        save('status_internal_cam', 'Routine-Photo ' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + "-F"+ str(i+1))
        
        focus_thread = threading.Thread(target=stack_focus, args=(i,))
        photo_thread = threading.Thread(target=stack_photo, args=(i,))
        
        focus_thread.start()
        photo_thread.start()
        
        focus_thread.join()
        photo_thread.join()

def move_motor():
    rotor_angle = position[0] - position_last[0]
    msg['payload2'].append(rotor_angle)
    #if abs(rotor_angle) > 180:
    #    rotor_angle = -360 * rotor_angle / abs(rotor_angle) + rotor_angle
    tt_angle = position_last[1] - position[1]
    if tt_angle > 180:
        tt_angle -= 360
    elif tt_angle < -180:
        tt_angle += 360
    
    if rotate_tt_first:
        motorrun('tt',tt_angle)
        motorrun('rotor',rotor_angle, rotor_endstop_enable)
    else:
        motorrun('rotor',rotor_angle, rotor_endstop_enable)
        motorrun('tt',tt_angle)
    return

def check_diskspace():
    diskspace_threshold = load_int('diskspace_threshold')
    diskspace = getoutput('df -h / | awk "{print $5}"').split('\n')[1]
    available = int(float(diskspace.replace(' ','').split('G')[2])*1000)
    if available < diskspace_threshold:
        save('status_internal_cam', 'Routine-stopping')
    return

def focus(i):
    f = focuslist[i]
    camera('/v1/camera/picam2_focus?focus=' + str(f))
    if i < len(focuslist) - 1:
        i += 1
    else:
        i = 0
    return i

def send_telegram_message(message, telegram_api_token, telegram_client_id):
    telegram_bot_path = '/usr/local/bin/send-telegram'
    run([telegram_bot_path,"-a",telegram_api_token,"-c",telegram_client_id,"-m",message])

counter2 = 0

date_init = get_current_timestamp()

if telegram_enable:
    telegram_message = "[START] " + hostname + " starting " + projectname + "(" + str(photocount) + " photos) ETA: "
    try:
        send_telegram_message(telegram_message, telegram_api_token, telegram_client_id)
    except Exception as e:
        print(e)

for position in coordinates:
    counter += 1
    filepath = basepath + 'tmp/' + projectname + '_' + str(counter) + ".jpg"
    if load_str('status_internal_cam') == "Routine-stopping":
        break
    if counter < 6:
        ETA = ''

    save('status_internal_cam', 'Routine-Photo ' + str(counter) + '/' + str(photocount) + ETA)
    if counter > 6:
        check_diskspace()

    move_motor()
    sleep(load_float("cam_delay_before"))
    
    if stacksize ==1:
        returning = [counter2]
        photo(returning)
        counter2 = returning[0]
    else:
        photo_stack()

    sleep(load_float("cam_delay_after"))
    ETA = '-ETA:' + str(int((photocount / counter - 1) * (time() - starttime))) + '/' + str(
            int(photocount / counter * (time() - starttime))) + 's'
    
    # Calculate time remaining and write status to /tmp/status as JSON
    elapsed_time = time() - starttime
    estimated_total_time = (elapsed_time / counter) * photocount * steps
    time_remaining = max(0, estimated_total_time - elapsed_time)
    
    status = {
        "scan_name": projectname,
        "total_photos": photocount,
        "current_photo": counter,
        "stacksize": steps,
        "start_time": int(starttime),
    }
    with open('/tmp/status.json', 'w') as status_file:
        json.dump(status, status_file)

    position_last = position

zip.close()
try:
    send_telegram_message("[STOP] " + hostname + " stop " + projectname, telegram_api_token, telegram_client_id)
except Exception as e:
    print(e)
camera('/v1/camera/picam2_switch_mode?mode=0')

save('status_internal_cam', 'Routine-done')

try:
    remove('/tmp/status.json')
except FileNotFoundError:
    pass  # File doesn't exist, so no need to delete
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error deleting /tmp/status.json: {e}")

motorrun('rotor', -position_last[0], rotor_endstop_enable)
motorrun('tt', position_last[1])

save('status_internal_cam', '--READY--')
date_end = get_current_timestamp()


if counter == photocount:
    system('mv ' + zippath + " " + basepath + "scans/" + projectcode + ".zip")
    aborted=False
else:
    aborted=True
    if delete_aborted:
        remove(zippath)
    else:
        system('mv ' + zippath + " " + basepath + "scans/" + projectcode + ".zip")

scan_data = ScanData(
    arch=architecture,
    openscan_version=openscan_version,
    openscan_branch=openscan_branch,
    shield=shield,
    date_init=date_init,
    date_end=date_end,
    num_photos=photocount,
    done_photos=counter,
    camera=camera_model,
    stack_size=stacksize,
    telegram_enabled=telegram_enable,
    delete_aborted=delete_aborted,
    endstop_enabled=rotor_endstop_enable,
    group_stack_photos=group_stack_photos,
    aborted=aborted
)

stats.write_statistics(scan_data)
return msg

name: loadI
write
get dirs
func: from glob import glob import os from zipfile import ZipFile from datetime import datetime from PIL import Image def set_stats(stat): try: with open(directory+set[:-4]+"/"+stat,"r") as file: stat=file.read() except: stat="" return stat table=[] directory="/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/" for d in glob(directory+"*.zip"): set=os.path.basename(d) try: with ZipFile(d, 'r') as f: photos = len(f.namelist()) if not os.path.isfile(directory + 'preview/' + os.path.basename(d)[:-4]+'.jpg'): image = f.open(f.namelist()[int(photos/2)]) img = Image.open(image) width, height = img.size width_factor = width/300 height_factor = height/295 if height_factor>=width_factor and height_factor > 1: new_size=(int(width/height_factor), int(height/height_factor)) img = img.resize(new_size) elif height_factor 1: new_size=(int(width/width_factor),int(height/width_factor)) img = img.resize(new_size) img.save(directory + 'preview/' + os.path.basename(d)[:-4] +'.jpg') list=[] for fi in f.filelist: list.append(f.getinfo(fi.filename).date_time) duration = str(datetime(*max(list)) - datetime(*min(list))) size = float(int(float(os.path.getsize(d))/100000))/10 size_full= os.path.getsize(d) status=set_stats("status") expiration=set_stats("expiration") download=set_stats("download") if len(download)!=0: table.append({ "Set":set, "Photos":photos, "Size":str(size)+"MB", "Date":set[:16], "Name":(set[20:-4]), "Status":status, "Download":"RESULT", "Size_full":size_full, "Duration":duration, }) else: table.append({ "Set":set, "Photos":photos, "Size":str(size)+"MB", "Date":set[:16], "Name":(set[20:-4]), "Status":status, "Size_full":size_full, "Duration":duration, }) except: pass msg['payload']=table msg['topic']="" return msg

name: upload
func:
import os
from OpenScan import OpenScanCloud, load_str, load_int, save
from subprocess import getoutput

basedir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'

if load_str("feedback_terms")=="False":
    msg['payload']="Please read and agree to the Terms of Use (See Settings Menu) before you can use the OpenScanCloud"
    msg['topic'] = 'OpenScanCloud - Terms of Use'
    return None,msg

msg = msg['payload']

def upload(filelist, ulinks):
    pid = getoutput('pidof curl')
    if pid != "":
        os.system('kill ' + pid)

    i = 0
    for file in filelist:
        link = ulinks[i]
        save('status_cloud', 'uploading ' + str(i+1) + '/' + str(len(filelist)))
        cmd = 'curl -# -X POST ' + link + ' --header Content-Type:application/octet-stream --data-binary @"' + file + '" 2>&1 | tee /home/pi/OpenScan/settings/status_uploadprogress'
        i = i+1
        os.system(cmd)

########
if not os.path.isfile(basedir + 'settings/token'):
    msg['flag'] = True
    save('status_cloud', 'please enter token first')
    return msg
with open(basedir + 'settings/token', 'r') as file:
    token = file.read().strip('\n')

########
r = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo', {'token':token})

if r.status_code == 400:
    msg['topic'] = 'Invalid Token'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please enter a valid token (settings --> OpenScanCloud)'
    save('status_cloud', 'invalid/missing token')
    return None,msg
elif r.status_code == 200:
    pass
else:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection Error'
    msg['payload'] = 'Not able to establish a connection to OpenScanCloud.'
    return None,msg

msg1 = r.json()

########
if msg['Photos'] > msg1['limit_photos'] or msg['Size_full'] > msg1['limit_filesize']:
    msg['flag'] = True
    save('status_cloud', 'limit(s) exceeded')
    return msg

########
temp =  OpenScanCloud('getProjectInfo', {'token':token, 'project':msg['Set']})
if temp.status_code not in (200,401):
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection to OpenScanCloud failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please check your internet connection'
    return None,msg

if temp.status_code != 401:
    temp = temp.json()
    if 'status' in temp:
        if temp['status'] != 'created':
            save('status_cloud','already exists')
            with open(basedir + 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4] + '/status', 'w') as file:
                file.write(temp['status'])
            return msg
#####

msg2={}
msg2['token'] = token
msg2['parts'] = 1
msg['partslist']=[]

#######
size_to_split = load_int('osc_splitsize')

if msg['Size_full'] > size_to_split:
    tempdir = basedir + 'tmp/split/'
    if os.path.isdir(tempdir):
        os.system('rm -r ' + tempdir)
    os.mkdir(tempdir)
    save('status_cloud', 'zipping files, please wait ...')
    cmd = 'split -b ' + str(size_to_split) + ' ' + basedir + 'scans/' + msg['Set'] + ' ' + tempdir + msg['Set']
    os.system(cmd)
    save('status_cloud', 'zip done')
    list = os.listdir(tempdir)
    for l in list:
        msg['partslist'].append(tempdir + l)
        msg['partslist'].sort()
    msg2['parts']=len(msg['partslist'])
else:
    msg['partslist'] = [basedir + 'scans/' +msg['Set']]

#######
msg2['photos'] = msg['Photos']
msg2['filesize'] = msg['Size_full']
msg2['project'] = msg['Set']

r = OpenScanCloud('createProject', msg2)
if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection to OpenScanCloud failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please check your internet connection'
    return None,msg

msg1 = r.json()

if not os.path.isdir(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4]):
    os.mkdir(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4])
with open(basedir+ 'scans/' + msg['Set'][:-4]+'/status', 'w+') as file:
    file.write('prepared')

save('status_cloud', 'uploading')
upload(msg['partslist'], msg1['ulink'])

r = OpenScanCloud('startProject', msg2)
if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['topic'] = 'Upload failed'
    msg['payload'] = 'please try again'
    save('status_cloud', 'upload failed')
    return None,msg

save('status_cloud', 'uploaded')

save('status_cloud', 'project started')

try:
    os.system('rm -r ' + tempdir)
except:
    pass

return msg

name: refresh
func:
from time import sleep
import os
from OpenScan import load_str, OpenScanCloud, save, load_bool

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'

if load_bool("terms")==False:
    msg['payload']="Please read and agree to the Terms of Use (See Settings Menu) before you can use the OpenScanCloud"
    msg['topic']='OpenScanCloud - Terms of Use'
    return None,msg

save('status_cloud','refreshing')
token = load_str('token')

test = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo',{'token':token})
if test.status_code == 400:
    msg['topic'] = 'Invalid Token'
    msg['payload'] = 'Please enter a valid token (settings --> OpenScanCloud)'
    return None,msg
elif test.status_code == 200:
    pass
else:
    msg['topic'] = 'Connection Error'
    msg['payload'] = 'Not able to establish a connection to OpenScanCloud.'
    return None,msg

stats = test.json()
for i in stats:
    save('osc_'+i, stats[i])
    pass

msg={}
projects = []
for i in os.listdir(basepath):
    if i == 'preview':
        continue
    if os.path.isdir(basepath + i):
        if os.path.isfile(basepath + i + '/status'):
            with open(basepath + i + '/status', 'r') as file:
                status = file.read().strip('\n')
                if status in ['expired', 'processing done', 'processing failed']:
                    continue
        projects.append(i)

for p in projects:
    r = OpenScanCloud('getProjectInfo',{'token':token, 'project':p+'.zip'})
    if r.status_code == 200:
        answer = r.json()
        if answer == {}:
            os.system('rm -r ' + basepath + p)
        else:
            with open(basepath + p + '/status', 'w+') as file:
                file.write(answer['status'])
            with open(basepath + p + '/download', 'w+') as file:
                file.write(answer['dlink'])

msg['list'] = projects
sleep(0.5)
save('status_cloud','ready')
return msg, None

from os.path import getsize
from shutil import copy
from os import rename, remove
import zipfile as z
from OpenScan import save

from time import sleep

if msg['payload'] != 'OK':
    return

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'
tmp1 = basepath + msg['set1']
tmp2 = basepath + msg['set2']

if getsize(tmp1) > getsize(tmp2):
    set1 = tmp1
    set2 = tmp2
else:
    set1 = tmp2
    set2 = tmp1

zips = [set1, set2]

with z.ZipFile(set1, 'a') as z1:
    z2 = z.ZipFile(set2, 'r')
    i = 0
    for n in z2.namelist():
        i += 1
        n2 = n
        save('status_cloud','writing ' + str(i) + '/' + str(len(z2.namelist())))
        while 'X'+n in z1.namelist():
            n = 'X' + n
        z1.writestr('X'+n, z2.open(n2).read())
save('status_cloud','ready')

os.rename(set1, set1[:-4] + 'X.zip')
os.remove(set2)

return msg

name: diskspace
func:
from subprocess import getoutput
from OpenScan import load_int

diskspace_threshold = load_int('diskspace_threshold')

diskspace = getoutput('df -h / | awk "{print $5}"').split('\n')[1]

available = int(float(diskspace.replace(' ','').split('G')[2])*1000)


if available < diskspace_threshold:
    msg['topic'] = 'Low diskspace remaining! ('+str(available)+'MB)' 
    msg['payload'] = 'Please delete some/all locally stored files.'
    msg['color'] = 'red'
    return msg

name: read
func:
from OpenScan import load_str
from os import listdir, path

status = load_str('status_cloud')

if status[0:9] == 'uploading':
    progress = load_str('status_uploadprogress')[-6:]
    if progress[-1:] == '%':
        status = status + ' (' + progress + ')'

if status[0:7] == 'zipping':
    path1 = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/split/'
    files = listdir(path1)
    size1 = 0
    for file in files:
        size1 += path.getsize(path1+file)
    size2 = path.getsize('/home/pi/OpenScan/scans/'+ files[0][:-2])
    
    status = 'zipping files (' + str(float(int(1000*size1/size2))/10) + '%)'

msg['status'] = status
return msg

name: ssh
General
payload:
General Settings

Terms Of Use

In order to use the OpenScanCloud, please read the terms of use as files will be transmitted from your device to the OpenScan Servers.

SSH

SSH can be used to access the Raspberry Pi and modify core files of the operating system. Please deactivate, if you do not want to use this feature.

If you want to use it, the default user is pi, password: raspberry. Please change the password immediately. 

Samba

Samba s a network local file sharing server, which allows accessing the Raspberry Pi's file system through the explorer (and other programs like FileZilla). You can use it to transfer custom photo sets to the device in order to use the OpenScanCloud. Therefore, you need to transfer the zip file containing your photos to the following folder /OpenScan/scans/

You can access the Raspberry Pis file system by inserting the following line into your Windows explorer: 

\\OpenScan/PiShare/OpenScan/scans/

username: pi, password: raspberry

Please deactivate the local file sharing if you do not intend to use it

Advanced Settings

Enable a ton of additional settings, which should be changed only if you know what you are doing ;)

Model

Device model you are using: OpenScan Mini or OpenScan Classic. Setting the device affects the settings of the motor (gear ratio, acceleration, speed). You can change those values manually in the advanced settings.

Camera

A wide range of camera modules is supported (Pi camera v1.3, v2.1, HQ, Arducam IMX519, IMX290, IMX378, OV9281). If you encounter any issues with those models, please check the orientation of the camera ribbon cable and its connectors.

DSLR (gphoto) - connect a wide range of DSLR cameras to the device through USB. See GPhoto for a full list of supported devices.

External camera - triggering any camera through an isolated GPIO signal on the front side of the pi shield.

Shutdown/Reboot

Always use the shutdown button before you power off your Raspberry Pi.

Restore Default Settings

In case you want to restore the default settings

name: Pinout
payload:
Pinout

ONLY CHANGE THE PINOUT IF YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY SURE! CHANGES CAN DAMAGE THE RASPBERRY PI AND ANY PERIPHERALS!

name: smb
Motor
payload:
Motor Settings

Turntable Mode

Activate turntable mode in order to deactivate the rotor. The routine will only move the turntable and take a given number of photos.

Rotor - Start Angle, Min and Max Angle

Since this version of OpenScan does not have an endstop (yet), it is necessary to tell the device its position when the routine is being started. 0° corresponds to the horizontal (natural) orientation.

After that, the device will equally space the image positions between angle min and angle max.

Rotor/Turntable

Steps per rotation -  defines the number of steps it takes to move the axis 360°. It is defined by A*B*C, where A is the number of steps for one revolution of the given stepper motor (normally 200), B is the microstepping used (normally 16), and C the gear ratio (1 for the turntable and 15 or 5,33 for the OpenScan Mini and Classic respectively)

Delay - time in microseconds between each step of the motor. Lower this value if the movement is too fast

Acceleration - a factor defining how fast the delay time between each step is being changed during acceleration and deceleration phases. Lower this value in order to make the movement smoother.

Acceleration ramp - the number of steps allowed for the acceleration processes. Increase this value, if you want smoother movement.

Manual Angle - Defines the degree value for the manual movement through the arrow buttons in the scan menu

Direction - If needed, reverse the movement (in case the arrow buttons and movement do not correspond). Alternatively, you can flip the motor cable 180° (BUT MAKE SURE TO POWER OFF THE DEVICE!)

name: camera
payload:
Camera Settings

Jpeg quality

Value in percent, which usually does not need to be changed.

Downscale Preview

The preview image has to be scaled down depending on your network speed. If you want to have a higher quality preview image, you can increase this value, which defines the maximal width/height value. If the value is too high, the preview window might not update

Image Rotation

Change the image rotation, if needed.

Timeout

Defines the time in seconds, when the libcamera command (used for the camera modules) will timeout. Increase this value, if the camera does not get triggered in each position.

Delay Before/After

A fixed delay in seconds before and/or after a photo is taken. Increase this value when the photos have visual motion blur.

AWBG, Gain, Contrast, Saturation

Under most circumstances, you do not need to touch these values.

name: Cloud-settings
payload:
OpenScanCloud

OpenScanCloud is a free/donation-based cloud processing service, which will convert your photos into 3d models using latest photogrammetry technology. Feel free to support the project with a small donation at BuyMeACoffee.

The only requirement to use this service is a one-time, free-of-charge registration (which is solely an anti-spam measure). By filling out the registration form, you will receive an individual access token.

Register

In order to use the OpenScanCloud, you will have to enter your name and email. It might take 1-3 days to create the access token, which will be sent to your mail address. Please check your spam folder.

Enter Token

Please enter your individual token here in order to activate the cloud functionality. The token will be verified immediately. In case of any problems, please contact cloud@openscan.eu

Token

A shorted version of your token will be displayed here. Please include a copy of this shorted token in any support requests cloud@openscan.eu

Credit (GB)

Each token comes with a given amount of 'credit' which is another measure against spam. The given number in Gigabyte indicates the amount of data, that you can process on the servers. 

IMPORTANT: The credit can be increased at any time by sending a (nice) mail to cloud@openscan.eu

name: save
func:
import requests
import os
from OpenScan import save, OpenScanCloud

if msg['payload']!="Yes":
    return None,msg

try:
    r = OpenScanCloud('getTokenInfo', {'token':msg['token']})
    if r.status_code != 200:
        msg['payload'] = 'Could not verify token'
        return msg 
    
    msg1 = r.json()
    
    save('osc_credit',msg1['credit'])
    save('osc_limit_filesize',msg1['limit_filesize'])
    save('osc_limit_photos',msg1['limit_photos'])
    msg1['enabled'] = True
except:
    pass

save('token',msg['token'])
    
msg['payload'] = 'Token verified and saved'
return msg, msg1

msg
Update&Info
payload:
Update&Log

Status

See whether new updates are available. It is highly recommended to use the latest firmware version. See OpenScan2 on Github.com for details and the source code.

Updatetype

- stable: latest well-tested and mostly bug-free version for the OpenScanMini or Classic and various cameras

- beta: stable version + some experimental and new features, which might bring joy and some new bugs as well

- mini: very simplified firmware for the OpenScanMini + Arducam IMX519

Auto-Check update availability

Perform an automated update-check after each start of the device. If the device is connected to the internet, it will get the latest files from OpenScan2 on Github.com

This option is activated by default.

Check Updates

Alternatively, you can check for updates manually at any time by pressing this button.

Download Error Log

In case you encounter any errors with your device, please download the error log text and send a copy to info@openscan.eu or create an issue on Github.com

from OpenScan import add_wifi_network, check_hotspot_mode
from time import sleep

sleep(0.5)

error = ""
if msg['ssid'] == "":
    error = "SSID, "
if msg['password'] == "" or len(msg['password'])<8:
    error = error + "password, "
if msg['country'] == "" or len(msg['country']) != 2:
    error = error + "country code"

if error != "":
    msg['payload'] = error
    msg['topic'] = "Invalid Input(s):"
    if check_hotspot_mode():
        msg['mode'] = True
    else:
        msg['mode'] = False
    return msg


msg['result'] = add_wifi_network(msg['ssid'],msg['password'],msg['country'])

sleep(3)

if check_hotspot_mode():
    msg['mode'] = True
else:
    msg['mode'] = False

msg['topic'] = "Added wifi & connected"
msg['payload'] = "changes might take a moment ;)"

return msg

name: loadI
write
create beta new
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil

#scope = 'main'
scope = 'stable'

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stealthizer/OpenScan2/2024-11S/update/2024-11S'
updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'


## load update.json
r = requests.get(url + 'update.json')

if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['status'] = 'download update.json failed'
    return msg

msg = {}
with open(updatepath_temp, 'wb+') as file:
    file.write(r.content)
with open(updatepath_temp, 'r') as file:
    msg = json.load(file)

msg2 = msg.copy()
if scope in msg:
    del msg[scope]

msg[scope]={}
msg[scope]['1'] = {}
msg[scope]['1']['src'] = scope + '/fla.py'
msg[scope]['1']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/files/fla.py'

msg[scope]['2'] = {}
msg[scope]['2']['src'] = scope + '/OpenScan.py'
msg[scope]['2']['dst'] = '/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/OpenScan.py'

msg[scope]['3'] = {}
msg[scope]['3']['src'] = scope + '/config.txt'
msg[scope]['3']['dst'] = '/boot/config.txt'

msg[scope]['4'] = {}
msg[scope]['4']['src'] = scope + '/flows.json'
msg[scope]['4']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/settings/.node-red/flows.json'

msg[scope]['5'] = {}
msg[scope]['5']['src'] = scope + '/settings.js'
msg[scope]['5']['dst'] = '/root/.node-red/settings.js'

#msg[scope]['6'] = {}
#msg[scope]['6']['src'] = 'files/logo.jpg'
#msg[scope]['6']['dst'] = '/home/pi/OpenScan/files/logo.jpg'

for i in msg[scope]:
    filepath = msg[scope][i]['dst']
    filesize = os.path.getsize(filepath)
    msg[scope][i]['filesize'] = filesize

if os.path.isdir('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/'):
    os.system('rm -r /home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update')    
os.makedirs('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/')

with open('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/update.json', 'w+') as f:
    json.dump(msg, f, indent=4)

for i in msg[scope]:
    if not os.path.isdir(os.path.dirname('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src'])):
        os.makedirs(os.path.dirname('/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src']))
    shutil.copy(msg[scope][i]['dst'], '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/update/' + msg[scope][i]['src'])

msg['payload'] = 'created with scope: ' + scope

return msg

name: prepare image creation
func:
import os

#factory reset, reset wpa, create wpa in boot, rm files
#should be done before creating a new raspbian image

basepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/'

#remove files

dir = basepath + 'scans/'

for i in ['scans/','tmp/']:
    os.system('rm -r ' + basepath + i)
    os.mkdir(basepath + i)

#delete wifi
temp_dir = '/home/pi/OpenScan/tmp/wpa_empty.log'
wpa_dir = '/etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf'

with open(temp_dir, 'w+') as file:
    file.write('update_config=1\nctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant\ncountry=de\n\n')
os.system('mv '+ temp_dir + ' ' + wpa_dir)
os.system('wpa_cli -i wlan0 reconfigure')

#create new wpa_supplicant.conf
with open('/boot/wpa_supplicant.conf','w+') as file:

name: get update
func:
import json
import requests
from OpenScan import load_str

if not msg['payload']:
    msg['status'] = '--READY--'
    return msg

openscan_version = load_str('openscan_version')
openscan_branch = load_str('openscan_branch')

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stealthizer/OpenScan2/' + openscan_version + '/update/' + openscan_version
updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'

r = requests.get(url + '/update.json')

if r.status_code != 200:
    msg['status'] = 'no internet connection'
    return msg

with open(updatepath_temp, 'wb+') as file:
    file.write(r.content)
with open(updatepath_temp, 'r') as file:
    msg = json.load(file)

msg['status'] = 'checking updates'
msg['url'] = url
msg['openscan_branch'] = openscan_branch
msg['openscan_version'] = openscan_version

return msg, msg

name: check files
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil
from OpenScan import load_str

openscan_version = msg['openscan_version']
openscan_branch = msg['openscan_branch']

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = msg['url']
updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'

counter = 0
for i in msg[openscan_branch]:
    filepath = msg[openscan_branch][i]['dst']
    temp = updatepath + os.path.basename(filepath)
    if os.path.isfile(temp):
        filesize = os.path.getsize(temp)
        msg[openscan_branch][i]['filesize2'] = filesize
        if filesize == msg[openscan_branch][i]['filesize']:
            msg[openscan_branch][i]['update'] = False
            continue
    msg[openscan_branch][i]['update'] = True

    counter += 1

if counter == 0:
    msg['status'] = 'No new update available'
else:
    msg['status'] = 'New update available'
    msg['topic'] = msg['status']
    msg['payload'] = 'Install & reboot now?'

msg['counter'] = counter

return msg

name: loadS
write
write
download files
func:
import json
import requests
import shutil
from OpenScan import load_str, save

openscan_version = msg['openscan_version']
openscan_branch = msg['openscan_branch']

updatepath = '/home/pi/OpenScan/updates/'
url = msg['url']

if msg['payload'] != 'YES':
    return

counter = 0

for i in msg[openscan_branch]:
    if msg[openscan_branch][i]['update'] == False:
        continue
    
    filepath = msg[openscan_branch][i]['dst']
    temp = updatepath + os.path.basename(filepath)
    
    r = requests.get(url + '/' + msg[openscan_branch][i]['src'])
    if r.status_code != 200:
        msg['status'] = 'downloading ' + msg[openscan_branch][i]['src'] + ' failed'
        return msg
    with open(temp, 'wb+') as file:
        file.write(r.content)
    shutil.copy(temp, msg[openscan_branch][i]['dst'])
    
    if msg[openscan_branch][i]['dst'] == '/boot/config.txt':
        save('camera','')
    
    counter += 1

msg['status'] = 'Installed ' + str(counter) + ' of ' + str(msg['counter']) + ' - restarting ...'

if counter == msg['counter']:
    updatepath_temp = updatepath + 'update_temp.json'
    updatepath_old = updatepath + 'update.json'
    shutil.move(updatepath_temp, updatepath_old)

return msg

name: msg
loadB
msg
func:
from subprocess import getoutput
import os

msg['os'] = getoutput("cat /etc/os-release | grep -i 'PRETTY_NAME'")[13:-1]
msg['device'] = getoutput("cat /proc/device-tree/model")
msg['flask'] = getoutput("systemctl status flask |grep -i 'Active:'").split(' ')[6]
msg['osdate'] = getoutput("vcgencmd version").split('\n')[0]
msg['temp'] = getoutput("vcgencmd measure_temp").split('=')[1]
cpu_total = getoutput("free -m | head -n2 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")
cpu_used = getoutput("free -m | head -n2 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
swap_total = getoutput("free -m | head -n3 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")
swap_used = getoutput("free -m | head -n3 | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
diskspace_used = getoutput("df -h / | tail -n1 |awk '{print $3}'")
diskspace_total = getoutput("df -h / | tail -n1 |awk '{print $2}'")

msg['cpu'] = cpu_used + '/' + cpu_total + 'MB'
msg['swap'] = swap_used + '/' + swap_total + 'MB'
msg['diskspace'] =diskspace_used + '/' + diskspace_total

if msg['flask'] == 'inactive':
    os.system('systemctl restart flask')

return msg

msg.headers = {
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------d74496d66958873e"
}


msg.payload = '--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="select"\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
'true\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="print"\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
'true\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e\r\n'+
'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="'+msg.filename+'"\r\n'+
'Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n'+
'\r\n'+
msg.payload+'\r\n'+
'--------------------------d74496d66958873e--\r\n';


return msg;
